characters: GRUESOME, ITS LONG TEETH GLIMMER IN THE LIGHT. IT GOES F
PART OF SIXPACK'S FACE--ONE EYE AND PART OF HIS
ON MONITOR THE CAMERA HOLDS ON THE SPOT. SUDDENLY THE
SUN, DAZZLING THROUGH A MILLION DROPLETS OF WATER AS A HU
JUMPS, BUMPING HIS HEAD ON THE SINK AS HE WHIRLS TO SEE.
SUDDENLY, LIKE A SNAKE, A TWO FOOT CHUNK OF MUSCLE ATTACH
HUNDRED SLEDGEHAMMERS POUNDING THE HEAVY STEEL DOOR TRYIN
WE SEE THE BLACK SCALES SPREADING
THE INSIDE AND INVERTS SCALY--SPREADING OVER COBB'S BODY
SUDDENLY RISING OUT OF THE WATER BEHIND THEM IS THE
POINTED STRAIGHT DOWN. SHE FIRES, SENDING A SEARING BLUE
SUDDENLY WE HEAR A SOUND WE HAVEN'T HEARD IN A LONG TIME.
ONE FALLS AND CRASHES INTO THE WATER
BECK POUNDS ON THE BUTTON AND LOOKS UP JUST AS THE CREATU
TO GO ON, AND CASTING AN EERIE STROBE EFFECT ON THE ESCAP
WILLIE RETURNS TO THE SITE OF THE CHARGE AND REINSERTS HE
THE SHACK CONTINUES TO SHAKE, EACH JOLT STRONGER THAN THE
TENTACLE HURLS TOWARD BECK LIKE A SPEAR.
THE TWISTING, WRITHING THING OFF. PULLING AT IT HE REVEA
OUTSIDE SECONDS BEFORE THE ENTIRE STRUCTURE COLLAPSES WIT
DIVES FOR HIM, ITS HUGE SCALY HAND GRABBING HIM AROUND
FALLING CEILING BEAMS CRASH DOWN IN FRONT AND BEHIND...
SWELL CARRIES HER UP EVEN HIGHER.
JONES LEADS THE WAY TOWARD THE SWAMP, WITH WILLIE BEHIND
BEHIND THE SUITS SHATTERING THEM LIKE AN EXPLOSION
SUNLIGHT IS STREAMING DOWN THROUGH THE WATER AS SHE RUSHE
BURSTS THROUGH THE WIRE MESH OF THE MACHINE FLOOR AND PUL
THE WATER AT THEIR FEET NOW BOILS FROM VIBRATION
SEAMS BEND UNDER THE STRAIN, RIVETS POP...
GROUND SHAKES VIOLENTLY ON THE MONITOR SCREEN--A MINI
AN EYE OPENS AND LOOKS UP.
ON THE SHADOW OF THE CREATURE
REACHES OUT FROM THE SHADOWS, AND PULLS HER INTO THE DARK
SUDDENLY THERE IS A TREMENDOUS BANGING ON THE DOOR
THE LIGHTS FLICKER AND FAIL, CAUSING THE EMERGENCY LIGHTI
SUDDENLY SHE BREAKS THE SURFACE AND CATCHES A GLIMPSE OF
STEAM JETS WHIP DOWN ON THEM FROM ABOVE
STRAINING MACHINES SEND SCALDING GEYSERS OF STEAM INTO TH
IMPLOSION AND SUDDENLY EXPLODES IN A HUGE SHUDDER OF ENER
DRILL, EASILY REMOVING A TEST SAMPLE.
BECK TURNS AND SEES THE SUITS IN THE LOCK
SUDDENLY MARTIN'S FACE APPEARS ON THE VIDEO SCREEN.
DROPS OF BLOOD INTO A SMALL POOL
WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL WE ARE WATCHING A VIDEO SCREEN IN
ON WILLIE STANDING OVER THE OPENING, HER FLAMETHROWER
SIXPACK/BOWMAN CREATURE IN ALL ITS HIDEOUS GLORY
THE BILGE WATER ON THE FLOOR OF THE SWAMP RIPPLES WITH TH
BECK BUT JONES MOVES BETWEEN THEM.
CORRIDORS...AND SUDDENLY THE FLOOR GIVES WAY BENEATH WILL
HIM, AND BECK COVERING THE REAR.
IN A BLINDING FLASH OF ELECTRICITY
THE FORE DECK OF THE SHIP
ON THE DEJESUS CREATURE'S SEVERED APPENDAGE
THE HUGE METAL SUITS ROCK LIKE CLOTHES ON A CLOTHES LINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON  The Pet of the Month as she smirks coyly from t centerfold, her body twisted into an awkward position representing mad desire. Sixpack closes his privacy door then smirks back at the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Darlin'...come sit on my face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stirs in the bed and adjusts his pillow and SCREAMS! SEA SPIDER is suddenly right there on his shoulder, dead. Sixpack sits bolt upright in his bunk and slams his head against the roof of the bunk, then stumbles out screaming He hits the floor and rams his foot into a table and scre in more pain. The whole dorm looks up amazed, Cobb takes off his sunglasses, even Jones and DeJesus temporarily "sober up" stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bitch!

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: Sixpack storms into the Mess with the dead Sea Spider.  H points angrily at his bleeding foot.  Jones and DeJesus m up to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving into room) Bitch!  Look what you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Sixpack) Sorry, darling...Just thought a little humor would loosen us all up...you know?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs, but Sixpack.  He has revenge in his eyes He holds out the ugly, limp creature and advances toward Willie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're so funny? Wait till you taste this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pushes the dead creature into her face BECK'S VOICE behind him makes him freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody turns to see Beck standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my foot, sir!  This bitch put a goddamn sea monster in my bunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold as ice) How do you know it was Williams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trapped) Huh?  I...uh...uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Sixpack, you and Williams are gonna pull water duty tomorrow--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting) Bullshit!  What?!  She...He...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting them off) At ease!  You both have a half day...Anymore shit and its a full one.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBOARD/ MESS
dialogues.text: SCREECH!  Chalk on the blackboard as Bowman writes "2" in place of yesterday's "3" over the neatly lettered words "Days Till Pickup." Jones, sitting next to Cobb, looks up from his tray of cereal and holds his head in mock misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooh.  Damn!  Not so loud. Turn down the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What music?  There ain't no music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus enters holding his head and sits on the other sid of Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks from one man to the other, realizing what they doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's really crazy to pretend to be drunk, but it's fucking insane to pretend to have a hangover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jones and DeJesus) Your "hangovers" made you miss the Sixpack Good Morning Show. (imitating Sixpack) "No goddamn boy is going to make me go out on a down day."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Yeah?  How'd the kid hold up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased) Pretty good.  He sent them out videotaping outcrop.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON  A whirling cylinder tool we see is attached to end of Willie's mechanical suit arm.  Like a drill its diamond bits cut into the rock outcrop to take a core sample.  It's a sinister hand-attachment, something Capta Hook would have loved. Above her the ROV maneuvers into position for a better vi

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SHACK CONTROL
dialogues.text: Beck is in the control station, staring at the video monitors--the image from the ROV.  Willie removes a slend instrument, like a bicycle pump and with a quick pump motion, CHUNK, CHUNK...activates an explosive charge.  Sh puts it into the hole she made with the drill and backs o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge set.  Backing off. (to the ROV) C'mon Rover let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a good dog, the ROV follows her to a safe position.

dialogues.speaker: DRILL, EASILY REMOVING A TEST SAMPLE.
dialogues.text: Willie holds out the sample to the ROV so Beck can see inside.

dialogues.speaker: BECK'S ROV MONITOR
dialogues.text: He stares at the image on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more light on that, Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beck) Roger... (to Sixpack) More light, Sixpack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer.  Willie turns around.  Her helmet lam eerily illuminating the darkness around her.  Sixpack is nowhere to be seen. WILLIE(cont'd) Sixpack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns in the other direction and suddenly blinding lights are turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack laughs.  His lights now on, he stands right behin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Four?  What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine, Shack.  His lights malfunctioned for a minute.  How's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She again holds out her hand to the ROV.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SHACK
dialogues.text: Beck looks at the monitor and presses a red button to sta the tape, then after five seconds releases the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great.  Now let's move 35 degrees southwest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sixpack) You screw around like that again and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, did you miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, darlin, I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Sixpack's foot hits some loose rock and slides. Willie turns in his direction and sees his headlight turning, becoming smaller, then disappearing as his radio goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?!  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  She has stopped in her tracks.  All around her blackness.  Her helmet light hardly penetrates the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack?!  Sixpack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she looks down--a cliff right in front of her feet. The drop is thirty feet into a waving sea of tubers. BECK'S VOICE brings Willie back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  I think he's fallen.  I'm going down after him.

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: Jones is bench pressing 200 pounds on a fold-down compact gym, while DeJesus huffs and puffs on an exercise bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it Jonesy...Sweat it out, man...Got to get the poison out of our blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones grits his teeth and struggles against the weight, suddenly Bowman throws open the door and sticks her head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack is lost.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bowman, Jones and DeJesus are heading for the control roo where they are joined by Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't they tied?  They're supposed to be tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all enter the

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Beck is at the console with Doc in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far away is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIE'S VOICE silences them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four to Shack...nearing the bottom.  Look at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare at the monitor.  The screen is filled with huge waving tubers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, look at the size of those tubers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine, ten feet high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he had his blinkers on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't make any difference in there...He could be two feet away and on fire and she'd still not see him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  She moves through the dense waving forest of giant tubers, parting them with her hands as she moves slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we pick up his signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a joke) Maybe he got eaten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) What would be dumb enough to eat Sixpack?

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: She moves aside the last of the tubers and freezes at the sight in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four to Shack...you picking this up?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: All eyes suddenly go to the monitor.  A huge dark maw fil the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative...Widening picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image on the screen widens and we see the opening is huge gash in the side of a sunken ship. BECK(cont'd) (to DOC) Tighten the picture on the upper righthand corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE MONITOR:  The picture zooms in on the corner and Willie's added light suddenly brings the letter "M" i focus. Beck presses the red record button and pans the ROV slowl across the bulkhead of the ship.  The next letter is an " Then suddenly a Cyrillic letter appears, then others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your air reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes!...Who had tank duty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else...Sixpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is unbelievable... I say, leave him in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) What about his suit?  That's a million five the company's got to replace.  They'll make somebody go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Willie) Willie, we're giving you five minutes...after that we're coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her life-support gauges move eerily around the perimeter her mask.  She moves along steadily down darkened corrido She opens a door and it drops from its corroded hinges--a cloud of sludge rises off the bottom.  The room looks emp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack?...Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws open another door.  It also looks empty, then WHAM! a grotesque ECHONODERM slams into her helmet.  Will bats it aside and as soon as she recovers shines her ligh into the room. WHAT SHE SEES:  The ship's infirmary.  Broken glass, stainless steel...the light does strange things, reflecti sparkling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infirmary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her helmet-mounted camera pans the room one more time, th as she turns to leave it captures a strange gleam of whit in the corner--A LARGE HUMAN-LIKE SKELETON.  Willie doesn see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DOC  He stares at the monitor screen.  Did he se something or were his eyes playing tricks?  He looks acro the console and sees the videotape is recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  She moves to the end of the hall.  It ends wit two doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie hesitates at the junction and PUSHES OPEN the door her left, SOMETHING HUGE BEHIND IT MOVES--IT'S SIXPACK. mechanical arms suddenly rise and in their grasp we see t ship's huge safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'm rich, honey.  Rich!

dialogues.speaker: THE SWAMP
dialogues.text: The door to the Russian ship's safe stands open.  BANG! BANG!  Jones and DeJesus hammer safety deposit boxes with chisel.  While the others watch, Sixpack pleads his case with Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all mine if I'm on report. Otherwise you gotta take me off report before you look at any more... Ain't that right, Cobbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on your own, Sixpack, you fucked up everybody's day off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus pries off the top from the first safety deposit b and dumps the contents on the workbench...several wallets wristwatches, a pocket watch, a wedding ring...Bowman who stands with a clipboard begins taking inventory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal effects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering a watch) Timex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up something else, a pack of soggy chewing gum tosses it to Cobb. WILLIE(cont'd) Here's something for you, Cobbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking a wallet) Russian money...Don't look like much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones opens the next box and dumps it out onto the table...Life Savers candy, a postcard of a fat Russian wo in a bathing suit.  Bowman looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning to Sixpack) Yeah, I'd say you can retire with all this loot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone chuckles.  More papers and a small, book-shaped object wrapped in plastic.  Jones unwraps it.  It's a vid tape.  He looks at the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "Debbie Does Dallas"... (looks up and grins) Hell, it's in Russian.  I can't read it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones hands it to Doc who looks at it. DOC (cont'd) It's a log of some sort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones pries the lid off another box and dumps it out--Papers, more cheap watches. ON SIXPACK  He notices something silver, the size of a paperback book, under a stack of papers.  Discreetly he covers the object with a piece of paper and slides it off the table out of sight. Jones opens the last box, and something rolls across the table toward the edge and starts to drop when it is caugh by DeJesus.  He holds it up and we see--a clear liquor bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What assholes, they lock booze in the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably confiscated.  No booze on board, same as us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc turns the bottle around in DeJesus' hand so he can re the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the bottle) Stolichnaya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read Russian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German, a little Hindu, some Serbo Croat and a smattering of Swahili...standard pre-med background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb stares at him a second then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) ...and a Russian grandmother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck ignores them and addresses Bowman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want all this stuff impounded in the supply safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts the bottle of Stolie out of DeJesus' hands. BECK(cont'd) ...except this...it goes in my safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disappointed crew watches Beck leave with the bottle. stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beck, holding up the videotape) You mind if I take a look at this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving) Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The gloomy corridor outside the Infirmary.  It is empty, silent.  Suddenly the door to the Infirmary opens slightl and Bowman peeks out.  Seeing the corridor is empty she slips out with a a manila folder.

dialogues.speaker: DORMITORY
dialogues.text: Bowman hands the envelope to DeJesus, who's grinning delightedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack and Jones are there too.  Sixpack scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good's the kid's med records anyway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch and learn, amigo...

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see a thin, bearded man in his late fifties, a RUSSIAN SHIP'S CAPTAIN talking to the camera in Russian.  The tap is of poor quality and water spotted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) Another party last night.  More Vodka.  The infirmary is filled as it is.  I confiscate what I can, but I know the Government Observers have more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the captain hears a noise off-screen and goes t the camera and turns it off.  The tape goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: ON DOC
dialogues.text: He stops the tape and presses another button on the conso WILLIE'S VIDEO of the huge hole in the hull of the ship appears on another screen. DOC(cont'd) See that gash?  The way the edges protrude inward is like from a torpedo explosion.  It couldn't have come from within. Like an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back at Beck who we see is sitting behind him, a has also been watching the tape.  Beck looks at Doc and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? That it all sounds mysterious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These observers were doing something. A test...I think they sank that ship on purpose to cover up their mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What mistakes? (he shakes his head wearily) Look, I think it's no big deal but if you want to find out why this ship sank have Maritime run a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and goes to the door.  Doc watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  They have no record of the wreck. (beat) The Marshal Goloviev is now on a tour in the Baltic Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck stops.  This is a mystery.

dialogues.speaker: COMBINATION LOCK/ BECK'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Fingers fiddle with the combination.  He pulls on the handle.  The safe doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) It's not the phone number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back to see that DeJesus is alone in Beck's darke quarters, he talks to the P.A.  Suddenly we hear BOWMAN'S VOICE over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Okay, try the social security number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus puts his fingers back, on the safe dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give it to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading off of Beck's forms) Two...twelve...ninety-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffingly) You guys are so full of shit... Who's going to use their birthday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over intercom) BINGO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly sitting up) Like I said, that bottle's mine!

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: ON Beck at the door and Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want your permission to check that vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks at him.  It is obvious that he doesn't trust D with the vodka, but he's diplomatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mining shack, not a lab, Doc.  If there's something strange with the vodka it's safe till we get back.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: ON COBB  Standing watch for DeJesus.  Suddenly the door t the Control room opens and Beck walks out.  Cobb grabs a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck's coming.

dialogues.speaker: BECK'S QUARTERS/ ON DEJESUS
dialogues.text: He hears Cobb and freezes.  He looks around--the cramped quarters don't offer much in the way of hiding places.

dialogues.speaker: BOWMAN AND OTHERS IN DORMATORY
dialogues.text: They react similarly to the sound of Cobb on the P.A.

dialogues.speaker: ON COBB AND BECK/ CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Beck stops outside his door and sees Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Cobb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Uh..Excuse me sir, it's the air recirculating system, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking fast) ...I'd really have to show it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) All right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb smiles, he can't believe his luck, then Beck holds u the videotape. BECK(cont'd) ...Just let me put this in my safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Cobb can react Beck opens the door to his quarters and steps inside. BECK'S QUARTERS  WE SEE no sign of DeJesus.  Cobb follows into the room, looking carefully around for sign of DeJes In the mirror to Beck's bathroom, Cobb spots DeJesus pressing against the wall.  Cobb suddenly starts to sweat bullets.  Beck quickly unlocks the safe, opens it, and pu the videotape right next to the bottle of Vodka. We see Cobb's reaction.  Beck turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb shakes his head weakly and starts to follow Beck out he sneaks a look back at DeJesus in the shadows who gives him a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: Five specimen cups filled with vodka.  Bowman takes hers looks at it questioningly.  Cobb watches the door for sig of the officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, DeJesus...Specimen cups?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, loosen up, Bowman... (he looks over and notices Willie) Hey, Willie, I got one served up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.  I've got my blood tests in three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you do is exercise. You got to learn to live a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After my astronaut training physical, then I'll tie one on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget space cadet, I'll drink hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey what happens it he goes back and finds the bottle missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a plastic IV bag filled with clear liquid. DEJESUS(cont'd) I poured the vodka in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, Jones, DeJesus, Bowman, and Sixpack grin and clink glasses, then knock back their vodka.  Afterwards we get their reactions. JONES:  Looks concerned. BOWMAN:  Shakes her head, something's wrong. DEJESUS:  Can't get the taste off his tongue. COBB:  Seems totally satisfied. SIXPACK:  who has held the liquid in his mouth savoring i suddenly spits the vodka out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  It's water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck switched it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you beat that?  The sonof- abitch doesn't trust us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie grins at her co-workers and Beck's move and jogs o into the corridor.  Sixpack disgustedly tosses his shot glass away and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little turd.  If I ever get the chance I'll fix his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others put down their glasses disappointedly except Bowman.  She watches Sixpack.

dialogues.speaker: DORMITORY
dialogues.text: SIXPACK'S BUNK  He closes his privacy door and hesitates if listening for the others, then he removes a silver fla with Cyrillic lettering--the silver object he palmed in t Swamp--and smiles as he takes a long pull.  Suddenly WHAM The Privacy door to Sixpack's bunk is slammed open. Startled he turns startled to see--BOWMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I ever tell you vodka was my favorite drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out her glass.  Sixpack looks around the Dorm, it's empty, then grins sheepishly and pours her a shot.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR "B"
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  She is jogging through the corridors.  Suddenl there is a GREAT GROANING NOISE.  Willie stops and looks through the steel mesh wall into the machine floor.  The dark shapes of the machines move monstrously in the dim light.  The GROANING ends and she jogs on to the Swamp. As she passes the door she notices the light and stops. stands with a clipboard by an equipment cabinet filled wi the parachute-like Container Transporters we saw outside. He sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a loud one wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a month of it you'd think I'd be used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves into the Swamp and goes to the Lift Lock, stopp under one of the ladders she leaps up and grabs a metal r above her and begins doing her chin-ups as Beck watches h lean body easily doing the exercises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching her) How's astronaut training?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You going to give me hard time like the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm just being friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Good...It's going good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck tries to concentrate on his inventory, but continues watch Willie's sexy, athletic body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever made you want to do a tour down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need electrical field experience on my resume. Everything helps... (she watches him) Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody in corporate training serves a tour on the line.  Sup- posed to hone leadership skills or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it helped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there's not a lot of adventure in the Control Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks up and they lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I should hang around more with the crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I always heard you don't "learn" leadership, you earn it. (beat) How did you know they'd get into the vodka?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks up from his clipboard and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I figured if I was in their shoes that's what I would've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Maybe you're more one of us than you think...sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREECH!  The chalk shrieks across the blackboard, making "1" over the words "Days Till Pickup." Jones looks up from his cereal at Bowman, the culprit wit the chalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puuleeeeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus puts on his wet suit which goes under his large mechanical suit and gets ready to join the others in the mess.  He notices Sixpack's privacy door is still closed bangs on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sixpack...Rise and shine amigo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer.  Carefully he opens the door and is surprised to find it empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Sixpack's eye.  We pull back to see it is being examined by Doc who frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack obliges as Beck enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good imitation of a hangover and I ought to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it ain't!  It feels a thousand times worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I dunno.  I just feel... wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack pulls off his shirt.  Doc frowns in surprise. WHAT HE SEES:  SIXPACK'S TORSO  There are strange black areas, each of them an inch in diameter. DOC (cont'd) (concerned) How long...how long have you had these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, scared) Shit, Doc...I didn't know I had them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc peers closely at the skin where it's discolored.  It' different texture.  Beck watches as Doc touches a spot an Sixpack screams in agony.  Doc and Beck lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BECK'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MARTIN on Beck's video monitor.  He is drinking cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as long as you know it's not in your contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, suit yourself, then...its your decision... (he chuckles) Ha ha...a little joke...suit yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck interrupts impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the weather for pickup tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at a report, then up at Beck) Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: THE SWAMP
dialogues.text: The crew members climb into their suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad as he is there's no way we can make our quota with- out his sad self out there. You just can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) He's tanking on us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...he's really sick.  I heard him last night.  The company will take that into consideration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, the company don't give a flying fuck about "whys," they just look at the numbers and the contract says if we miss our quota they only got to pay us half-pay for the entire month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (convinced) 'Cocksucker's tanking on us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly all eyes go to the door, Beck enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to DeJesus) No, he's really sick...He won't be going out today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew increases its bitching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes our quota...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty days, right down the toilet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck ignores them and goes to the control rack which send the suits around the room and pushes number 8--his suit. DeJesus and Jones share a look.  Bowman and Willie watch carefully.  As Beck's suit stops in front of him the room quiet, they can't believe their eyes.  Awkwardly, Beck tries to get into his suit.  Cobb breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a contract violation, Mr. Cobb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir...I just wanted to know if you needed a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck sees he's sincere, then looks at the others and Will She nods slightly.  Beck turns back to Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc and Sixpack.  Doc takes a blood sample, seals it and opens a cabinet under the sink where a supply of blood is stored in a refrigerated unit.  The plastic bags of blood are labeled with the various crew members' names. Sixpack watches him from the examination table.  He is shivering violently and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's losing it) Please, Doc...I'm cold...I hurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a change in Doc's demeanor.  He is suddenly needed and it has touched something in him and we see him rising the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to take a tiny piece of skin to look at under the microscope...Afterwards I'll give you a sedative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skillfully Doc takes a skin sample.  Sixpack screams.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW THROUGH THE MICROSCOPE
dialogues.text: An enlarged view of the cells in alarmingly hyperactivity We see it literally spreading before our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON DOC
dialogues.text: He leans back from the microscope.  There is awe on his f for the first time since first year medical studies--and there is fear of the unknown.  He looks over his shoulder Sixpack, his shivering has stopped, he lies still on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights move in the blackness, but there is an order to th actions and a crispness to the voices.  People doing work that is moving sharply.  Pride in what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, number 23's full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get it out of here and bring in a new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hook's on 24...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Container transporters fill with compressed air and l the container as the miners guide it to the track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc is at the console of his computer.  As words appear o the screen, obviously in response to his query... "...would appear to indicate a virus of unknown origin... Doc shakes his head disgustedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) No kidding?  "A virus of unknown origin."  Come on and tell me something I don't know... like what's going on...

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: More words come up.  "...no idea..." DOC(cont'd) (typing, angrily) Then take a guess, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes typing and waits for an answer.  The cursor flashes the word "PROCESSING".  Then an answer comes up. "Genetic Alteration?"  The words send a chill down Doc's spine.

dialogues.speaker: SWAMP ROOM
dialogues.text: The mood is happy.  Like a high school football locker ro after a winning game.  DeJesus climbs out of his suit and slaps Beck on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work out there, Mr. Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck, obviously pleased, looks at the others.  Jones sums the feelings of the entire group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck's grin suddenly disappears at the sight of a flashin red light over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Beck is standing in the doorway of the Infirmary, glaring Doc, who sits with his bottle of Old Granddad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead?  This morning you said he had some skin disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how the hell does a skin rash kill you in eight hours?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks at Beck wearily and hands him a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Put this on.  You examine him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this...you don't need to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck hesitates, then puts on the mask.

dialogues.speaker: SICK ROOM
dialogues.text: As Beck enters, masked, Sixpack's back is to him under th sheets.  Slowly he pulls back the sheet and recoils from sight.  The black splotches have nearly all grown togethe His fingers have lengthened and become more webbed.  Most dramatically the sores on the sides of his neck have beco flared and elongated.  Though not bleeding, the open vein are visible.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Doc pours some bourbon in a glass, and takes a sip.  Beck enters dazed from the sick room and their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mask is because you think it might be...catching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I've been back and forth with Narragansett Naval all day, consulting with the best people in maritime medicine, the best people in viruses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they didn't believe the symptoms I described...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Why Sixpack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be a million things, something in the air, food.... (he looks up and locks eyes with Beck) But he went on that ship and so did Williams... (beat) I want to examine the crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in shock) Yeah...right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to the door and Doc watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've reported the death to the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mess is quiet.  All eyes are down.  Sixpack's absence noticeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Routine," my ass!  Ain't nothin' "routine" about no physical check- up 10,000 feet down...especially when we're getting picked up the next day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say it was a "routine check-up," he said it was a "routine precaution."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be bad.  Even sick Sixpack never missed a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this fucking air system....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't the food or the air system, he's just sick... Everybody gets sick every now and then.  It's all part of being human!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowman suddenly becomes pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I must be human because I'm sure as hell sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up from the table and dashes for the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE SKIN/, (COBB)
dialogues.text: Pale skin, fishbelly white with white hairs, seen closely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm kinda...outta shape... (a pause, no answer) This skin condition...what is it? Like herpes, or measles, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's difficult to describe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc is scrutinizing Cobb's flabby body closely.  They're alone in the shower room.  Stainless steel, and mirrors. stops and checks a place on Cobb more closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching, nervous) Christ, it'd be a hell of a thing if I went back to the roof with some kind of herpes thing.  My wife wouldn't understand that at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc peers closely, satisfies himself that it's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) She wouldn't understand.  She'd think I was down here fucking my head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARK SKIN/ PORES  Black skin, seen very close, the pores appearing like craters. We're looking at Jones' naked body...rippling muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbling) This whole thing's unnecessary, Doc. Only "skin problem" I got is white people... (beat, suspiciously) How come you're wearing those gloves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firm, lovely breasts, smooth skin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This disease...do you know what causes it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc turns Willie around and examines her firm naked buttocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.  You got any ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) You don't think it was from going on that ship do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a possibility.  But if it was that simple why haven't the symptoms begun on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc turns away to let her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean I'm okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fine.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER ROOM/ TAN SKIN
dialogues.text: DeJesus' body is being examined...tan skin, wiry muscles seen very close.  As we move along the skin, it seems eve moment as if the next instant will reveal a dread blemish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "a skin problem"... your skin changes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus, naked, with his back to us.  Doc examines him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It blackens...becomes scaly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) You mean like a fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus chuckles, but something about the thought stops D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) Yes...like a fish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I was just joking, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Beck sits in his chair reading the TRANSOCEAN OFFICERS INSTRUCTIONAL MANUAL. INSERT:  The chapter he's on says:  BODY DISPOSAL AT SEA. The face of Martin stares back at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, according to Maritime law, you, as commander of the Shack have the authority to dispose of the body.  However, the company doesn't want you to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you don't understand is that my crew is in jeopardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't have any proof at this point to assume that this disease is contagious, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not anxious to find out, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck, trust me.  If the company felt that you or your crew were in any danger we would authorize an immediate emergency pickup. We could be there in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Unfortunately.  We can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a sheet of computer paper. MARTIN(cont'd) There is a typhoon about 600 miles off the coast of Baja. It's not coming your way but the Company doesn't want to lose you folks or an emergency ship should it veer your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you saying?  That we're not even going to be picked up tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shouldn't be a long delay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a delay!  How long? A day?  Two days?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours, no big deal.  We should know something first thing in the morning.  Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Willie enters the room with several sinks and a couple of toilet stalls.  She approaches one of the sinks and pulls toothbrush from the pocket of her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo?  Doc says you're next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then she hears a retching sound from one of the stal WILLIE(cont'd) Bo?...You okay?

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Willie and Jones help Bowman into the Infirmary.  She is weak from nausea.  They help her onto the examination tab and look around for Doc.  Jones sees a light on in the Si Room.

dialogues.speaker: SICK ROOK
dialogues.text: Sixpack's body lies under a sheet in the Sick room.  The door opens and Jones looks in, sees Sixpack but in the di light, doesn't realize the sheet covering him, covers the body totally.  Jones smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hey, Sixpack...Hey, my man... How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer and Jones slowly approaches the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, we made quota to- day.  No thanks to you, you dog, but we made it...Beck helped us...We just dropped Bowman off.  I hope what you've got ain't catching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is almost to the table and reaches out to touch Sixpac when suddenly the body stirs.  Sixpack's foot moves sligh under the sheet as if shifting in his sleep.  Jones stops JONES(cont'd) Oh, man, sorry...you go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Jones returns to the examination room.  Bowman is now undressed and under the blankets on the examination table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixpack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping.  No sign of Doc, though.  I'll check the control room.  You look in the shower room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave Bowman GROANING on the examination table and h back to the main corridor.  As they leave WE HOLD ON the door to the sick room behind Bowman. Bowman writhes on the examination table in pain.  Careful she climbs off the table and goes behind a partition to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: BOWMAN
dialogues.text: At the sink in the infirmary.  She rinses her face in the sink and pulls back her hair, suddenly she stops and brin her hands in front of her face. INSERT HER HANDS.  Huge clumps of hair have come out in h hands.  And then she sees her hands themselves.  Scaly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God...what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at the light on in the Sick Room.  Sl she goes to the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: SICK ROOM
dialogues.text: Bowman approaches the body of Sixpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Sixpack...what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  She pulls back the sheet and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky) You have to call them back. Explain that this is an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir...Bowman's sick.  She's downstairs in the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) The infirmary?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, ain't that where we usually go when we're sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're simply concerned about her...proximity to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jones) Sixpack's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks from one officer to the other then grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit...I was just talking to him.  I saw him move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: LOWER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Beck hits the floor off the ladder and rushes to the Infirmary with Jones.  He opens the door and freezes. WHAT HE SEES:  The examination table where Jones left her empty.  The room deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to examination table) I left her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOC comes up behind them, then turns.  He hears to a HISS SOUND down the ring corridor.  He turns from the others a moves slowly toward the noise.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: Doc enters the shower room, full of steam and the SOUND O WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer and he moves toward the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowman.  It's Doc.  I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water continues to run.  No answer.  Carefully, Doc opens the shower door. WHAT HE SEES:  Bowman.  Dead.  Her wrists have been cut a blood swirls down the drain. Doc sadly squats down beside her.  The death effects him greatly.  He feels helpless, then suddenly his eyes widen and he carefully reaches out and takes Bowman's limp arm, turning it supine.  There, running the length of the arm, SEE the black scales.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Jones and Beck lay Bowman's body carefully onto the examination table in the infirmary.  Through the Sick Roo door we see the sheet shrouded body of Sixpack.  Doc cove Bowman with a sheet as

dialogues.speaker: THE MESS
dialogues.text: The remaining crew, Doc, and Beck assembled in the Mess. Doc sits quietly, almost in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you much about it, except that none of you show any symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it killed Bo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...she killed herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  the news hits her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting out of here just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's now a problem with the weather for pickup.  There's a typhoon in our sector... ...We're going to be delayed twelve hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typhoon?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we get time and a half.  That's in the contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck double pay, man!  I want out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their argument is suddenly cut short by a NOISE from the corridor.  A THUMP!  The crew stops their grumbling and listens.  A moment later we hear another THUMP!  Beck loo at Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions for Jones to come with him) Jones... (to the others) Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Beck leads the way slowly toward the Infirmary where the sound is coming from.  Outside the door they hear it once more.  THUMP! Carefully he enters the Infirmary and WE SEE the examination table is empty!  Beck goes to the Sick room a stops in the doorway.  Jones moves behind him and his eye suddenly widen. WHAT THEY SEE:  Both bodies now are in a motionless, hide conglomeration on the the table.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY ZIPPER
dialogues.text: ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ.  It is quickly pulled shut, running the length of a heavy plastic bag, closing both bodies inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in their rubber latex suits Cobb, Jones, DeJesus, Beck, and Willie carry the body of Sixpack and Bowman in zippered bodybag.  Now, well over three hundred pounds, t bodies strange shape and dead weight make it difficult to transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Cobb...you're slacking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) I ain't, goddamnit...It's Jones!..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jones can argue, Beck cuts them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Beck, the contract states that no body can be disposed of without authorization of---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the contract, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group turns into the Swamp where Doc waits for them b the Lift Lock.  Rounding the corner Cobb bangs into the s of a bulkhead and drops his corner of the "package."  Lik dominoes, Willie also looses her grip, then DeJesus.  The bodybag splashes into the grimy bilge water making it eve harder for everyone to get a handhold. BECK(cont'd) C'mon...Lift!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group struggles to raise the bodybag and just get it their shoulder when suddenly we go tight on DeJesus's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!...I feel something. It's moving!  He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel it, too...Someone's trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb drops his end intentionally and he kneels looking fo the zipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, what're you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he ain't dead!  He ain't dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb!  Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cobb grabs the zipper and starts to unzip the heavy b Beck tries to stop him when suddenly, WHAM!  a DARK APPENDAGE RIPS through the zipper and flails like a pressurized firehose.  It beats wildly for several second then lashes out at Cobb--ripping a gash on his forearm. While Cobb screams in pain, Beck yanks the appendage off Cobb's arm revealing a mouth full of needlesharp teeth an sharp tongue-like proboscis which has stabbed Cobb like a dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bit me!  It bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Beck and Willie wrestle the strong flopping appenda Doc rushes to the Lift Lock. DeJesus and Jones struggle to force the lurching bodybag into the Lift Lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push Hazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodybag shudders like a huge cocoon about to lose its occupant.  Jones digs his shoulder down into the task jus as the bag suddenly RIPS in several places.  A tear RIPS OPEN next to Jones' head revealing the head of BOWMAN, he vacant eyes only inches from Jones' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Christ!  I ain't never gonna sleep again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a WHINING NOISE sounds behind them.  Beck looks back to see Cobb approaching with a battery operated underwater chain saw.  He's clearly intending to cut the Creature with the whirring blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sixpack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus turns to block Cobb while the others continue to wrestle the bodybag into the Lift Lock.  The bag suddenly splits and a scaly arm protrudes.  It reaches out grabbin DeJesus.  Beck pulls him free and yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the Lock!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc hits the lever.  The elevator doesn't move! RRRRRRIIIIIPPP!  A scaly leg rips out of the body bag! BECK(cont'd) Hit it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc hits the elevator switch again, harder. NNNNNNN!  The Lift Lock door whines closed and a horrifyi SCREAM rises from the Lock.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIFT LOCK
dialogues.text: The end of the appendage is severed in the closing door, disappearing unseen into the greasy bilge water. BECK(cont'd) Flush it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc flips a switch and the SCREAM OF THE VACUUM PUMPS dro out the SCREAM in the Lift Lock, the wails of Cobb, and t splashing sounds of the severed three-foot section of gor muscle which slip silently and undetected under the workbench. A second later the elevator returns empty, silent, bloodstained. Beck turns on the video monitor of the exterior Lock.  Th exterior worklights illuminate millions of bubbles from t flush and the struggling movements of the bodybag before grows still once again and disappears beyond the range of the Shack lights...into the darkness. Beck turns and looks at his savaged crew.  Willie, Jones, DeJesus, Doc look like wet-suited butchers.  Splattered i blood, numbed by the experience, they are brought togethe by having simply survived.  Jones holds up Willie.  DeJes leans against the bulkhead.  In the far corner Cobb sobs quietly.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWERS
dialogues.text: Clouds of steam.  Vaguely seen through the steam, Willie scrubbing herself almost desperately, as though the spattered blood of the creature had penetrated into her skin.  Finally she gives up almost in tears and rests her head against the wall of the shower stall.

dialogues.speaker: DORMITORY
dialogues.text: Beck and Jones open the privacy door to Sixpack's bunk. After some digging which produces five month's supply of pornography, the empty flask clatters to the floor.  Beck picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we just found our problem.

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: Cobb pours himself a cup of coffee with a shaky hand.  Jo and DeJesus sit at a table and Willie laces up her shoes a run.  There is a feeling of anger among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serves his ass right to get it.  Motherfucker brings that shit onboard.  I hope his fucking ass rots in the sea and is shit upon by the fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fucker could have gotten us all killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie finishes tying up her shoes and looks at them all coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys sure weren't so holy when you were shooting that vodka...It could have been you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and walks out into the Ring corridor.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUSSIAN SHIP
dialogues.text: WE ARE MOVING along the ship's corridor that Willie walke looking for Sixpack.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Doc and Beck replay the tape of Willie's search for Sixpa on the Russian ship.  On the monitor screen we see Willie POV of the infirmary.  The light dances off the broken gl as she turns, then the flash of white we saw before as th light moves out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!  Rewind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck rewinds it. ON SCREEN  we see the scene again.  Light dancing off the cabinets.  As the light starts to turn--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck pauses the tape.  We see nothing. Doc is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back it up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck does and we watch Doc's face as he stares intently a the screen.  Suddenly he sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN  We see it.  Caught in the turn of the camera, frozen on the screen is the clear gleaming skeletal remai of a man.  Only it is clear that this is no ordinary man. Fingers and appendages are lengthened and broader than normal.  But it is the large head and long sharp teeth th especially catches our attention.

dialogues.speaker: ON A BEAUTIFUL BAVARIAN SETTING
dialogues.text: as a hand suddenly moves into frame and we see the scene actually one of DeJesus' jigsaw puzzles.  He takes a piec of blue sky from the hundreds of pieces on the table and places it perfectly into position on the puzzle.  Jones watches him amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that Innsbruck has 64 square miles of ski slopes, man?  Think about that. Sixty-four square miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up another piece of blue sky and effortlessly fi it into place as Jones watches.  It's blowing Jones' mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  That?...I've done this one before.  You hungry?  I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up to go into the mess and Jones looks at him in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry?  After what we just went through I may never eat again.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: She jogs down the corridors toward the Swamp.  The Shack CREAKS and Willie looks down through the grating passing below her feet.  It is dark down there.  Her feet pound o the metal grating. LOW ANGLE  We watch Willie from below as she jogs past. WE TILT DOWN to the dark, still water of the bilge.  Sudd something stirs in the water--a ripple like a trout in a stream.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Using a computer plotting program to measure the dimensio of the skull on the videotape, Doc enters these measureme as they are read off to him by Beck.  As each of the measurements go into the computer an image of a skull beg to appear on the computer screen, followed by a name: DANAKIL MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think they isolated him in genetic engineering. Homo aquaticus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danakil man?...one of our ancestors.  Named for the Danakil Alps in Ethiopia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly a big ocean country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was when it counted a couple of million years ago when the seas came in and drove us into the water.  Most homo sapiens didn't make it...Danakil man... adapted.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: running.  She jogs past the machine room.  Looking in, th machines seem alive, pulsing, the beating heart of the Shack.  There is something else though.  We feel somethin in there watching her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: On Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some say that's why we're basically hairless, for less water resistance, faster swimming speeds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about those scales... or that leech-like thing that bit Cobb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why stop with just one aspect of marine life?  Why not incorporate the best genetic components the ocean has to offer?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to screen) Well, if they were perfecting an aquaman, then why's there a dead one onboard that Russian ship?  Why isn't he out swimming around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks up at the image on the screen.  The huge skull stares back hauntingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) He obviously lacked something in his environment.

dialogues.speaker: DORMITORY
dialogues.text: ON COBB  He sits on his bunk and peers under his bandage. He turns on an overhead reading light and looks again. Suddenly a voice startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turned black yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first startled, Cobb recovers and answers sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Cobb.  If it was going to turn, it would have done its trick by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy for you to say. You ain't the one that got bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones starts to leave when he suddenly notices something Cobb's bunk.  He picks it up and we see a photo of Cobb's family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you're getting soft on us, Cobbie?  You're the fellow who always said--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb snatches the photo back from Jones and glares at him with the same old, hard "Cobb look."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's changed, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones leaves, and Cobb waits till he is gone then looks b at his photo.  His look changes, softening.  Absently he scratches his bandage.

dialogues.speaker: SWAMP
dialogues.text: Willie enters and checks her running time on her watch. bends over to catch her breath then straightens suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE are watching her from above.  For a moment she is quie as if listening for a noise somewhere in the Swamp.  She looks around slowly and her eyes come to rest on the Workbench.

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: DeJesus looking for food.  In the gloom of fluorescent lighting he opens and closes various cabinets looking for snack. He notices that the floor's wet near the sink.  He frowns and hears a SMALL NOISE, like something shifting slightly He moves to investigate, crouching low, peeking into the shadows under the sink, into a litter of cleanser bottles pails, rags...All he can see are shadows.  He looks more closely, actually sticking his head under the sink when

dialogues.speaker: JUMPS, BUMPING HIS HEAD ON THE SINK AS HE WHIRLS TO SEE.
dialogues.text: JONES, looming over his shoulder, looking down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, everybody is jumpy... What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not fully recovered from the start, DeJesus rubs his brui head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus gets to his feet, points at the water under the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably the plumbing.  You gonna make me finish that puzzle by myself, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus continues to scrutinize the water then looks back Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at his sandwich as Jones starts out of the galley.  Something is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Mustard.  Need mustard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the refrigerator and finds the mustard jar empty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Sixpack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the jar in the trash then opens the cabinet nex to the refrigerator for a new jar, and reaches inside.

dialogues.speaker: MOUTH--UNDERNEATH THE SURFACE.
dialogues.text: DeJesus falls against the side cabinets screaming and causing an avalanche of pots and pans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MESS
dialogues.text: Jones is now putting a piece of the puzzle into place whe he hears THE CLATTER OF POTS AND PANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hazy...what're you doing now...cooking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer and Jones looks up. JONES(cont'd) (concerned) Hazy?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the door and looks in.  His eyes widen at the sight of DeJesus staggering toward him with the squeezing hunk of muscle. JONES(cont'd) Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Jonesy.  Oh, God, help me!  It's getting inside me, I can feel it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps coming at Jones who backs away slowly from his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazy, please...I'm going to get you some help, man...just don't touch me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones finds himself backing away until he is by the door the Galley.  He closes it, rushing through into the Mess the Ring corridor where he runs into Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Hazy...It's got him! Stay here and don't let him out.  I'm going to get the Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones runs out and leaves Cobb by the door.  Cobb watches him go.  As the noise in the Mess intensifies, we hear banging on the door, then DeJesus' anguished cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb backs slowly down the corridor toward the dorm.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Jones meets Beck and Doc leaving the control room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got Hazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What has?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those chunks of Sixpack!  Like a big leech, with those teeth!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get him to the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to try to remove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Cobbie downstairs watching the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted.  There is no sign of Cobb and the door to the m stands open.  The mess is empty.  Beck is the first one d the ladder followed by Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb?  Hazy?  Oh, shit...He's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb returns with a mining tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't doing nothing for that thing without something to defend myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing happens to be my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, both of you!  We've got to find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck suddenly looks around noticing something. BECK(cont'd) Where's Willie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, she's out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones...come with me.  Cobb, you and Doc check the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones and Beck move down the spooky corridor toward the Swamp.  Overhead, water moves through the desalinization conduit.  Jones eyes it warily.

dialogues.speaker: SWAMP
dialogues.text: They enter the quiet Swamp.  The suits hang silently like sleeping monsters.  Beck steps into the equipment room. Jones walks along the suits which hang in front of him. Their empty masks stare at him hauntingly.  He reaches th end and stands in front of the ladder where we earlier sa Willie doing chin-ups.  He looks down and sees her headba floating in the bilgewater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Willie lowers herself from the bar behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sudden sight of her nearly gives Jones heart failure, stumbles backwards into the ankle deep water and Willie drops from the bar laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) What on earth's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to smack your face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie picks up the strain in Jones' voice, her smile fad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeJesus...It's got him.

dialogues.speaker: THE EQUIPMENT ROOM
dialogues.text: Jones, Willie and Beck move quickly.  Beck pulls a portab laser drill which fits into the arm of the mechanical sui and attaches a portable power unit to the back.  Turning on it becomes a sinister close-range weapon. Willie opens an equipment cabinet and reveals deflated container transporters.  Beck notices and then looks up a Jones who opens a locked cabinet and takes out the bicycl pump/earthquake device we saw Willie use earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were, Doss were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck reaches out and takes the powerful weapon away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fire that in here and you'll bring the whole place down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones thinks about it for a moment, then reaches for one the Acetylene tanks.  He lights the end of it and a long blue tongue of flame whips out the door into the Swamp. Jones grins.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Doc and Cobb move into the Infirmary.  Doc goes into his office.  He takes three scalpels out of an equipment draw and then looks up, through the levolor blinds into the infirmary.  What he sees upsets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones working the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to intercom) Jones to Doc.  Doc?...Cobb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back to Beck, concerned. JONES(cont'd) (to Beck) Think it got 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not going through. The intercom's busted.  I thought DeJesus fixed that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, realizing) He did.

dialogues.speaker: INFIRMARY
dialogues.text: Doc leaves his office and slowly goes into the Infirmary the storage counter across the room--where the blood is stored.  WE SEE what disturbed him...the door to the refrigeration unit is ajar.  Doc opens the door to the cabinet.  The plastic bags are now empty.  Each one has b drained.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Cobb moves out of the Infirmary, carefully down the eerie corridor, his mining tool in front of him for security. There is a sinister feel to the place.  Each step only reveals a little bit of space ahead of him.  Suddenly he stops.  In front of him across the hall a cabinet which says:  ONBOARD COMMUNICATIONS, is torn open.  It is where DeJesus fixed the intercom the day before.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABINET
dialogues.text: The door is shattered.  Carefully, Cobb opens the door an WE SEE the guts of the wiring have been torn out--the ent system has been disabled. Cobb carefully examines the damage WHEN SUDDENLY A SCALY HAND-LIKE APPENDAGE slams into the cabinet door trapping COBB and sending his weapon to the floor.  Cobb turns directly into THE LEECH-LIKE MOUTH!  It's sharp teeth shine in the ligh poised to strike. Cobb's eyes closed, screams like a maniac, waiting for th tentacle to attack.  Then suddenly an UNGODLY SCREAM echo in the corridor. COBB opens his eyes to see the tentacle gone.  Doc is holding the smoking mining drill, his eyes glazed, as if has seen the devil itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently) It...almost got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc shakes his head dumbly.  He is in total shock.

dialogues.speaker: THE MESS
dialogues.text: The remaining group is assembled around the table.  Jones watches the door with one of the homemade flamethrowers. listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) I saw it!  It's big!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bigger than DeJesus?  How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's had a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
