dialogues.text: He holds out the empty blood bags.  A change has come ove Doc since Bowman's death.  The experience has slightly deadened him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It needs blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking great...You telling me we got a fucking dracula in here with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would explain the suction- like appendages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a leech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why there's a dead one on the ship.  It ran out of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dead one on the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks from Doc to Beck. JONES(cont'd) (sharply) Someone want to let the rank and file in on your little secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc looks at Beck, then Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster appears to be a genetic aberration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It has many traits of deep sea marine life...regeneration, scales, gills, even a period of dormancy... (more to Beck) but the fact that it remembered where the plasma was stored, or where the communication wiring was, may imply that it has some other quality...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky) What?...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck locks eyes with Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Doc) That it acquires intelligence from its victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligence may not be the right word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck semantics, Doc! You saying its like part DeJesus, part Sixpack, part Bowman?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiredly) I don't know.  I'm guessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) I say we should go get in the escape bubbles and get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hit the surface in the middle of a typhoon?...No, thank you. I'll take my chance down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie looks at Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our only chance is to lure it to the Swamp and flush it like we did the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how're we going to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck checks his flamethrower and looks at Jones.

dialogues.speaker: THE MESS
dialogues.text: ON BECK  He flexes his arm as a needle is taken from it. SEE a half-pint of blood in a bag, held by Doc.  He secur it and hands it back to Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I don't want to give up any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Jones who watches the door.  Jones looks back and nods.  The coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The door to the Mess opens and Beck slips into the shadow of the hall.  A second later Jones follows.  In the dim light they begin moving toward the Lower "B" corridor to Swamp.

dialogues.speaker: MESS
dialogues.text: Cobb, Doc and Willie alone in the Mess.  Cobb scratches h bandage.  Doc notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Itches like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off and let me have a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb pulls back the bandage and looks at the gash. INSERT COBB'S WOUND  Pink and healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks good to me.  I'll re-bandage it, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Willie. DOC(cont'd) Willie, would you clean it for me.  I'm going to the infirmary for supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and Willie stops him with a firm grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go out there alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Doctor.  I have to do what's best for this crew. (he pulls away) I need my bag.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOWER RING CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The door opens and carefully Doc steps out into the corridor.  He looks toward the Infirmary then starts up t ladder to the Upper Level instead.

dialogues.speaker: DROPS OF BLOOD INTO A SMALL POOL
dialogues.text: a grisly sight. WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL the drops coming from the plasma b of Beck's blood.  Beck stops the drip and moves on into t darkness of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Doc moves behind the computer keyboard in the dim light o the Control room.  His face lit by the computer monitor. types furiously.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Emergency Escape Bubbles...ready for activation..." DOC pauses looking at the message, then moves his hand to the SEND command and presses it.

dialogues.speaker: THE MESS
dialogues.text: Willie prepares a clean bandage as Doc examines the cut. smiles at Cobb like a friendly country doctor.  The tired now gone from his eyes.  He seems revitalized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, good as new.  Just keep your paws off of it. (to Willie) Do you have the new bandage ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.  Doc turns back to the sink and Cobb holds out arm to let Willie put the new bandage on.  As Cobb's arm comes up we suddenly notice a slight movement under his shirt.  Willie stops just before applying the bandage.  T movement intensifies--like snakes moving wildly beneath t cloth.  Cobb whitens...breaks out in a sweat.  Willie bac off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc?...Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back and Doc moves into her place as suddenly a leech-mouthed tentacle erupts from Cobb's waist.  It's ra sharp proboscis punctures Doc's chest right at the heart the leach mouth with it's hundreds of teeth attaches with vacuum-like suction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is too late.  Willie falls back screaming as Cobb' gash RRRRRRRIPS OPEN!  THE FLESH OPENING GROTESQUELY FROM

dialogues.speaker: THE POOL OF BLOOD
dialogues.text: A huge shadow falls over the pool left by Beck.  A scaly tentacle suddenly whips across the floor.  The DEJESUS

dialogues.speaker: AN EYE OPENS AND LOOKS UP.
dialogues.text: WHAT IT SEES  The outline of Beck lying "hurt" fifty feet away. It starts down the corridor toward it's prey--Beck.

dialogues.speaker: ON BECK
dialogues.text: A little behind him with the homemade flamethrower, Jones waits in the shadows.  Suddenly Beck hears something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) I hear something. Don't fire until we're both in the Swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones moves a little farther back. BECK(cont'd) Don't let him see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Creature approaches WE SEE Beck stand up like a wounded animal.  He begins dragging his "injured" leg beh him as he retreats toward the Swamp.  THE FOOTSTEPS MOVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON WILLIE  She bursts out the door to the MESS and heads toward Corridor "B."

dialogues.speaker: DOOR TO THE SWAMP
dialogues.text: Beck moves through the door to the Swamp and positions himself by the door.  He looks back and WE SEE Jones for first time, flamethrower poised, ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon baby c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHADOW OF THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: It moves steadily toward the door, moving right to the doorway.  Carefully it moves a dark, horrible hand-like appendage inside the doorframe.

dialogues.speaker: ON BECK AND JONES
dialogues.text: poised to kill when suddenly both men hear the same thing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck?  Jones!?

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: She turns the corner and freezes.  There, less than ten f away is the Creature.  A tentacle whips excitedly like a tail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS THE CREATURE starts to turn for Willie, Beck suddenly closes the vault-like door to the swamp on Creature's han trapping it vise-like in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run Willie!  Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature throws back its head and SCREAMS in pain as heavy door severs its appendage.

dialogues.speaker: ON BECK AND JONES
dialogues.text: As the writhing hand-like appendage squirms in front of t Jones blasts it with his flamethrower until the hand curl like a piece of bacon and it ceases to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.  Just like momma makes 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck opens the door--the corridor is empty.  Willie and t creature are gone.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE RUNNING
dialogues.text: She heads back toward the Ring corridor around the inner path toward Corridor "A".  In a full run now, every panel and instrument looks even more sinister--where is Cobb/Do

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DEJESUS CREATURE'S SEVERED APPENDAGE
dialogues.text: As the Creature moves after Willie we see its bloody stum suddenly sprout a new appendage!  Like a starfish it grow another leech like tentacle to replace the one it lost.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: She turns down Corridor "A".  A NOISE overhead in the wat conduit causes her to look up WHEN SUDDENLY A BLACK ARM

dialogues.speaker: REACHES OUT FROM THE SHADOWS, AND PULLS HER INTO THE DARK
dialogues.text: DOORWAY TO THE MACHINE FLOOR----IT IS JONES!  He pulls he between him and Beck in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered) Where's Cobb and Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) Cobb's cut...It was in him! It got Doc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, that's just great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Beck is followed inside by Jones and Willie.  It is empty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones rolls the large vault-like door closed and locks th Beck goes to the console and checks the instruments. Suddenly he sees something that causes him to freeze in h tracks.  A red light blinks ominously on the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  He sent them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escape bubbles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Jones stop in front of Doc's console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gravely) Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks at Doc's computer screen. ON SCREEN WE SEE DOC'S MESSAGE:  "...hope that our sacrif will mean that the human race will never know this awful mutation..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good doctor signed our death warrant.

dialogues.speaker: HUNDRED SLEDGEHAMMERS POUNDING THE HEAVY STEEL DOOR TRYIN
dialogues.text: TO BREAK IT DOWN.  Jones readies his weapon but just as suddenly, the BANGING STOPS.  Beck, Willie and Jones all nervously exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least we're safe inside here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck slides behind the Console and quickly types in a message.  WE SEE IT ON THE SCREEN.  "SHACK SIX REPORTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank goodness, you're still alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells nervously at the screen) Hey, man, you better get your ass out here right now and get us.  You hear me, motherfucker?  Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin smiles calmly back at the three of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please relax, Mr. Jones.  Every- thing is under control.  Naturally, when we received Dr. Warren's message we were concerned but would never have deserted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones lets out a breath.  Willie stares straight at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you coming for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles nervously) Well, that's the bad news. The typhoon did turn your way. (he looks at weather printout) Right now it is on a course--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer the question, man! When are you coming?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Hopefully in the next 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-eight hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize you must have gone through hell--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone?  Man, we're still here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) I can't change the weather. Try to get some rest.  I'll keep you posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns off his screen and the picture in front of Beck, Jones and Willie goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  Why don't you get some rest.  I'll stand the first watch.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Jones sits near the vent sound asleep, his weapon across his stomach.  Near him Willie lies still, eyes open.  She watches Beck across the room, standing at the window. He stares outside into the darkness for a moment, then as if a thought suddenly occurs to him he looks at the blank computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Request weather summaries January 14-21."  The cursor blinks back ominously then races across the screen.  "FIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Martin, you asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he hears a voice behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know, don't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yeah...I think they're just deciding what to do with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves into Doc's seat in front of the console and cal up the stock market program that Bowman was monitoring earlier. ON SCREEN  WE SEE:  Stock prices. Willie types in a series of commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing how my stock's doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN:  The words TransOcean Corp.  The capsulized re comes up on screen:  "TransOcean Corp. took a bath on wor markets today when news of a tragic mining accident was revealed to investors.  The Board of Directors...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Where?....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrolls forward in the report and suddenly freezes th words. THE SCREEN:  "...accident took place in Shack Six, Southe Sector of Pacific Zone 10...Seven dead.  All bodies missing."  Their names follow. ON WILLIE  as her name comes up she shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they'd just leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice behind them causes them to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the union, boss. We're all expendable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now awake.  He sits up against the air vent.  Sudde Beck listens, the room is deathly silent.  He looks over the air vent.  Jones is listening also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air's stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOP!  WHOOP!  Suddenly a KLAXON HORN sounds hystericall A blue light on the console blinks on and off.  It says "AIR."  Beck turns to the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on backup air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time does that give us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Less than an hour.  It's ruptured an air duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we fix it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There're twenty miles of pipe in the bilge, they could have tapped-in anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY WE HEAR A SOUND WE HAVEN'T HEARD IN A LONG TIME.
dialogues.text: The RATTLE THAT JONES AND COBB FIXED.  Jones and Beck hom in on the tell-tale noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) Cobb...Job security...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He locks eyes with Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're drawing us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves his seat and Jones checks his weapon as Willie watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go out there, that's what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck checks his make-shift flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much choice... without air, the internal pressure will fall and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crunch...Implosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie watches them a moment then picks up one of the min tools, the laser-drill, she powers-it up to check it.  He action stops both men and she catches their looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I'm sitting in here, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully the three move into the Lower Ring Corridor.  A they move we suddenly hear a new sound, DEEP, LIKE DISTAN THUNDER.  The sides of the shack tremble slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) The shack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's wondering what's happening.  We're losing air faster than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jones) Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones moves to the lead and turns down Corridor "A."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the power-wrench removing the bolts from the flooring.  The cover is removed and Beck and Jones peer d into the darkness.  Willie stands guard with the flame- thrower. ON JONES  He peers into the darkness below.  He wasn't a fan of the bilge even before the Creature, now he's scare shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jones can protest Beck drops the ladder and climbs down into the dark bilge.  Jones waits till he's at the bottom, then starts down behind him.  Willie looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spend all day down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuckin' worry, I ain't.

dialogues.speaker: BILGE
dialogues.text: From somewhere in the darkness we hear the HISSING SOUND ESCAPING OXYGEN and the FAMILIAR RATTLE OF THE AIR SYSTEM As soon as Jones reaches the bottom rung Beck shines a li into the eerie underground area. Pipes run overhead and on the walls.  A broken electrical conduit sparks over their heads.  The floor is ankle deep greasy water.  They start toward the noise.

dialogues.speaker: ON WILLIE
dialogues.text: Her back is to the solid wall(outside wall).  Her eyes mo from one end of the corridor to the other, not lingering long enough to distract her.  Sweat runs down her face an we hear another tremor in the Shack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself, calming herself) Okay, Williams...let's hear a tune. (beat, quietly at first) "Off we go...into the wild blue yonder..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER RUMBLE FROM THE SHACK causes her to pause.  She catches her breath and starts again. WILLIE(cont'd) "...flying high into the sky..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly looks into the Main machine area (behind the wire mesh of the other wall).  Was it something moving?

dialogues.speaker: BILGE
dialogues.text: ON BECK  He moves around a corner we recognize from befor with Jones' and Cobb's repair.  Beck floods the area with light and the break in the line is visible.  The pipe has been torn from the wall, it is totally unreparable.  What worse, electrical wires hang down, showering sparks into water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fix it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think!  Can we stop it?! Block it up?!  Shut down the line somewhere?!  Think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thinking, man!  You think I want to die!  I am thinking!  I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly his eyes widen.  Beck sees this and turns.  In h light WE SEE THE GLINT OF LONG TEETH AND THE HUGE BLACK FRAME OF THE COBB/DOC CREATURE!  It's leech-like appendag whipping in front of it like an excited cat's tail.  Befo it can strike, Jones pushes Beck out of the way and fires blast of flame from his flamethrower.  The CREATURE SCREA and disappears. As Beck falls his light lands in the bilge water and goes out sending the bilge into greater darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hit it.  But I can't see it!  Can you see it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks back at the ruptured pipe and suddenly has a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Swamp.  There's an over- ride switch in the Swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for the ladder when WWWWHHHHHHHHIP! out of the darkness the appendage wraps like a bullwhip around Jones arm.  The deadly proboscis, which stabbed Cobb, is poised like a dagger about to be plunged into the black man's thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively Beck whips out the mining saw and severs th tentacle.  The unseen Creature's SCREAM echoes through th Bilge.  Beck grabs Jones by the arm and pulls him toward ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry...Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly they slosh toward the ladder and hole in the floo fifteen feet away, moving closer...ten...eight....then suddenly ANOTHER APPENDAGE thrusts between the rungs of t ladder at them.  Beck ducks and leaps to the side.  He is less than six feet from the Creature.  In the dim light W SEE it wickedly bare its teeth. Beck's eyes go to the walls from one side to the other an spot the exposed power cable.  The Creature steps forward directly under the hole in the floor.  It is about to lun when a voice from above distracts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature looks up and sees:

dialogues.speaker: FLAME INTO THE BILGE.
dialogues.text: BECK watches the flame roar down on the monster and it gi him the moment of distraction he needs.  He leaps out of bilge water and onto a pipe on the wall then rips the bro power cable from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones!  Get your feet out of the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones jumps up and grabs a pipe running overhead as Beck thrusts the sparking cable into the water at the Creature feet.

dialogues.speaker: IN A BLINDING FLASH OF ELECTRICITY
dialogues.text: The current surges through the Cobb/Doc Creature sending instantly rigid.  A second later it crashes forward into water. Moving hand over hand toward the ladder Jones quickly cli out, followed by Beck.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHACK CONTINUES TO SHAKE, EACH JOLT STRONGER THAN THE
dialogues.text: LAST.  As they emerge Willie helps them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, the Swamp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for the Swamp down Corridor "A" when an enormo shudder goes through the Shack, causing the lights to bli and the floor to open beneath Beck.  The jolt knocks him back into the bilge.  Only grabbing onto the pipes just above the water stops him from falling back in. JONES stops and looks back over the missing grating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones moves instinctively back for him, but another jolt only widens the gap.  Beck yells to be heard over the din the collapsing Shack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck your orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps across the gap onto a remaining grating and thru his hand down into the darkness.  Beck lets go of one han then the other, to grab Jones' extended arm.  In one Herculean effort Jones pulls him out of the bilge.  Toget they leap across the chasm as the Desalinization Conduit collapses over their heads and water floods into Corridor behind them.  They have to go around the other way!

dialogues.speaker: AS THEY RUN
dialogues.text: KLAXON HORNS SOUND and a RECORDED FEMALE VOICE warns:  "F minutes until implosion..."

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDORS...AND SUDDENLY THE FLOOR GIVES WAY BENEATH WILL
dialogues.text: She leaps up and grabs an overhanging pipe and swings to firm ground.

dialogues.speaker: HIM, AND BECK COVERING THE REAR.
dialogues.text: THEY reach the end of the corridor and Willie and Jones t into the Swamp Annex.  Willie hits the door opener.  RRRR IT DOESN'T BUDGE.  The pressure has bent the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's jammed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately Beck backtracks to the corridor and pulls a h held spreader--like a "Jaws of Life"--from the wall.  He turns back to the Swamp when a BLACK SCALY ARM SUDDENLY

dialogues.speaker: BECK AGAINST THE WIRE
dialogues.text: His head held in place by the powerful arm, Beck looks almost directly into the dark eyes of the Creature.  Its gill-like slits flare.  Its mouth opens and we see a flas of its razor sharp teeth. Before Beck can move the leech-like appendage ruptures th steel mesh and its razor-sharp proboscis plunges like a knife for Beck's face.  At the last instant Beck move his head and the proboscis slams into the steel mesh.  The me loosens the creature's grip and Beck manages to reach a mining drill from the tools on the wall.  As the appendag starts to strike again Beck buries the whining tool into Creature's tentacle and breaks free. Scooping up the spreader Beck rushes to the Swamp door wh Jones and Willie are trying vainly to hand crank the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got hung up!  Try this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie stands back and Beck thrusts the Spreader into the tiny crack in the door the hand crank had made.  With Jon help the two men force open the door and all three rush inside the SWAMP.  Beck closes the door behind them. THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE INTONES:  "Five minutes to implosion."  And we feel it happening:

dialogues.speaker: ONE FALLS AND CRASHES INTO THE WATER
dialogues.text: JONES throws open the control panel and grabs the red handled emergency air switch, but he can only move it hal way!  It is jammed by the pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie grabs it with him, but even together it is not enough.  THE HANDLE BREAKS OFF IN THEIR HANDS!

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER AT THEIR FEET NOW BOILS FROM VIBRATION
dialogues.text: THE FEMALE VOICE INTONES:  "Four minutes..."

dialogues.speaker: BECK TURNS AND SEES THE SUITS IN THE LOCK
dialogues.text: He grabs Willie and pushes her toward the Lock where her suit hangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suits!  Get in them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie moves quickly but Jones doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suits!  Are you crazy! How're we going to get to the surface?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck yanks open the equipment locker revealing TANKS OF COMPRESSED AIR AND DEFLATED CONTAINER TRANSPORTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Jones who grins with renewed hope and they begin pulling the equipment out. BECK(cont'd) Get them in the Lock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones and Beck drag the tanks and the parachute-like Container transporters to the lock. ON WILLIE  She climbs into her suit and activates her generator.  Instantly her Vital Signs spring to life arou the perimeter of her helmet. THE FEMALE VOICE TREMBLES FROM THE VIBRATIONS..."Three minutes...to...implosion..." Beck and Jones throw the last of the supplies onto the elevator and Beck holds out the SEISMIC TOOL Jones tried arm himself with earlier.  He takes the tool from Beck an sticks it in the vest of his wet suit. Then suddenly he sees that there are only two suits in th Lock.  Beck will have to wait on his to move along the tr to the Lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your suit, Becky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones climbs onto the Lock platform and slides into his suit. Beck hits the Suit track button and his suit begins movin along the track toward the Lock.  A suit turns the corner from the storage room followed by one labeled BECK. Beck looks at the walls, they're shaking harder.  He move along the suit rack when suddenly THE CREATURE BURSTS FRO

dialogues.speaker: TENTACLE HURLS TOWARD BECK LIKE A SPEAR.
dialogues.text: BECK ducks just in time, grabbing a fire ax and chopping the appendage.  Another tentacle jabs for Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is too late.  It knocks the ax from Beck's hand an sends him to the floor.  Beck looks up at the Lock in tim see Jones seal himself into his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE APPROACHES BECK
dialogues.text: Beck looks at the others one last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, now!  That's an order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones hits the elevator button and the Lock closes as the elevator sends them down without Beck. BECK stands and arms himself with a mining drill, which h swings at the Creature driving it back.  As Beck gets the upper hand, the Creature turns its hideous face and Beck freezes.  There attached to the back of the Creature's he is the grotesque face of DeJesus! DeJesus' eyes suddenly blink.  He's still alive!  His lip tremble in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me...Kill me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck, momentarily stopped by the face, lunges forward wit the drill and embeds it in the side of the Creature. As the Creature falls back hurt, Beck looks up at the loc elevator as it returns--IT IS EMPTY--The others have made out!  His suit continues down the track and stops in the Lock.  He still has to make it, if he can just get there! THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE SOUNDS:  "One minute to implosion..." Beck races to the Lock and starts to climb into the suit. His arms slide into place, his legs drop into the heavy metal shell and as he seals up the back he activates the generator. BECK'S POV.  His vital signs light up around the perimete of his helmet, but he sees something else--the Creature charges toward the Lock--its arm reaches out to yank Beck out of the elevator!  Instinctively, Beck swings his motorized leg into the Creature's snarling mouth, knockin it backwards and stunning it long enough for Beck to hit elevator button.  BUT IT DOESN'T WORK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits again, still nothing! THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE..."Nineteen, eighteen..."  Her voice begins to quiver.

dialogues.speaker: BECK'S LEG
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE ELVATOR BUTTON  Beck pounds it one last time and NNNNNNNNNNNN!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: WHOOSH!  A parachute-like Container Transporter zoom towa the surface.  A heavy-suited crew member flashes past us. Its helmet light pierces the darkness, then disappears. moment later another Transporter follows, racing out of t darkness after the first. BECK'S POV  We see the vital signs lit in a ring around h helmet.  The depth gauge races past with blinding speed a he moves closer to the surface. WILLIE'S POV  She tilts her head upwards.  She snaps off light and sees instead of black, a lighter gray, then suddenly faint traces of light in the water above her.  A first it seems like her eyes are playing tricks on her, t we see it again--a glimmer of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light.  Beck, I see light!

dialogues.speaker: ON BECK
dialogues.text: He follows her look.  Light is coming fast, brightening a they rise.  The LED numbers inside their helmets click off..."125, 100, 75..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till you reach thirty- five before you blow your suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIE'S POV  Her numbers count down "....70, 60, 50, 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ejecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks at the handle on the chest plate and WHOOSH!  T plate bursts open and reveals a second interior handle. hand gropes for it.

dialogues.speaker: UPWARD.
dialogues.text: WHOOSH!  The helmet and torso of the suit are blown open she pulls the second lever detaching her from the balloon No longer oxygen supported or being pulled upward, Willie frees herself from the heavy suit and swims to the surfac

dialogues.speaker: SWELL CARRIES HER UP EVEN HIGHER.
dialogues.text: Then she's underwater again, struggling desperately to pu the tab on the life jacket around her neck.  Suddenly a M HAND GRABS THE TAB FOR HER AND PULLS.  She looks up at Be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding onto each other Willie and Beck ride a swell.  At the crest WE SEE JONES in the trough below, face down.  B breaks away from Willie and swims through the waves to re Jones.  Reaching him Beck pulls his face out of the water and inflates his life jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck lays Jones head back against the life jacket.  For a moment.  Jones seems lifeless, then his eyes blink and sq against the sunlight.  Beck turns back to Willie and as h and Jones ride the next crest he gives her the "thumbs-up WILLIE(cont'd) (jubilant) The sun!  The sun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks at Beck and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to that typhoon?

dialogues.speaker: CALM SEA
dialogues.text: BECK, WILLIE AND JONES cling to each other as they search the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you saw something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times I got to tell you.  I saw a ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why haven't they answered our flares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll fire one more, that leaves us one last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECK pulls the flare off his latex wet suit and fires it into the sky casting a comforting yellow glow over the da water.  The light fades, Willie looks at Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Jonesy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Tip top, Willie...tip top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testing him) Who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired, but with fight) Jameson?  Who are you trying to con...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both manage a weak laugh, then Beck sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned.  Look!...A flare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a small swell lifts them up we can see a tiny flare ju fading against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It saw us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer them and quit kicking me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not touching you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOOOOOOOSH!  Beck fires another flare into the sky.  As flare arcs downward, Willie feels another bump and for th first time sees the SHARKS CIRCLING THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...no, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHARKS tighten the circle as the flare fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAPTAIN watches the flare fade through his binoculars a speaks to someone O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you'd combed this area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers his binoculars AS WE WIDEN TO REVEAL MARTIN standing on the bridge.  He also lowers his binoculars an smiles coolly as he lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did....Many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Martin then to a Lieutenant) Initiate rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Martin's face as from

dialogues.speaker: THE FORE DECK OF THE SHIP
dialogues.text: A rescue chopper with pontoons lifts off the deck and ban off toward the fading flare.

dialogues.speaker: OCEAN
dialogues.text: Jones, Willie and Beck stay bunched close together. Suddenly Willie feels another bump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicky) It hit me!  Where are they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he is bumped by a shark.  Willie sees one only t feet away.  They are surrounded.  Suddenly Jones stare to taunt the sharks aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!  I've had enough of this shit!  You want meat, motherfucker?  Come on, eat me, sucker, try some dark meat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes away from the group despite Beck's attempt to s him. JONES(cont'd) (taunting sharks) What's wrong you snout-nosed bastards?  My meat too tough for you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazingly the sharks begin to disappear.  Willie and Beck watch stunned.  Even Jones is surprised. JONES(cont'd) (to Willie and Beck) Whoa!  Did you see those fools run?  They know whose boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jabs his arm upward in triumph and for the first time SEE a gash across his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jones crows triumphantly, WE SUDDENLY SEE HIS WET SUIT

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE/OCEAN
dialogues.text: Jones is chortling, suddenly his smile vanishes, somethin is happening... WE hear the DRONE OF THE APPROACHING HELICOPTER...THUMP, THUMP, THUMP...The blades of the helicopter sound out ove the waves.  It's lights are visible.  Willie and Beck wav frantically as Jones drifts closer to them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONES' LEGS  His wet suit is now completely split open an

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: hovers over the group below and lands on the water.  Its blades beat the surface into waves.  The WINCH OPERATOR hurls out a rescue harness and Beck helps Willie into the ring.  He CLICKS the fastener and suddenly they both lock eyes.  Before Willie can say anything Beck falls back and signals the Winch operator who begins hauling her to safe Immediately Beck locks back at Jones and extends his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonesy...Give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIE reaches the helicopter and quickly climbs out of t harness.  The Winch operator throws it back across the wa where BECK grabs the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones reaches out his hand.  He is almost there WHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonesy, No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, Becky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature grabs Jones and pulls him violently under. Beck watches horrified as his friend disappears.  Numbed clips the rescue harness around him when suddenly, WE SEE boiling of water where Jones disappeared...bubbles rising...and then Jones' bloody and tattered life vest bo to the surface several feet away from Beck. Beck reaches out for it just as the Creature appears agai It turns and focuses on Beck.  Beck keeps going for the l vest as the Creature starts for him.

dialogues.speaker: ON HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: The Winch operator and Willie watch in horror as the Creature bears down on Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he in the harness!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JONES' TATTERED VEST  Beck reaches it.  His fing wrap around the bicycle pump-like, seismic tool in Jones' vest pocket.  The Creature is right on top of him! CHUNK, CHUNK, Beck cocks it like a pump shotgun as tentac rise wickedly out of the water and wrap around Beck's bod in a death grip.  It's horrible mouth starts to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, motherfucker open up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature's mouth widens and as it starts to strike Be thrusts the seismic tool into its gaping maw and is sudde pulled from behind--out of the creature's grasp!  The res cable is taut!  The helicopter is taking off! BECK'S POV/ RISING SHOT.  Beck rises suddenly out of the water, the Creature growing instantly smaller below him until BOOM! the Seismic device explodes in the Sixpack/Bowman Creature, blowing it to bits across the oc surface!  The shock wave sends the helicopter banking off toward the ship with Beck safely attached by cable below The winch operator pulls him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck, dressed now in crisp white clothes, stands on deck the ship.  He glances occasionally at a door nearby marke INFIRMARY, then looks up as the Captain approaches and shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Beck, I understand you passed your physical with flying colors.  And Ms. Williams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) I don't know yet, she's still in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll be glad to know you have a friend onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks up surprised as suddenly Martin joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Beck!  I told them you'd make it.  No one back at TransOcean believed me, but I never gave up on you once. (smiling) So, how are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck looks at Martin for an instant then hauls off and in one incredibly smooth punch knocks Martin on his can acro the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better...A lot better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the door to the infirmary opens and Willie appe with a new outfit on.  Smiles at Beck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beck lets out a slight sigh of relief as a STEWARD approaches with a tray of WHOLE COOKED FISH, HIDEOUS LOOK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight is almost too intense for Beck and Willie.  The Captain notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we might have some wonderful seafood.  But, if there's something else you'd rather have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie stares at the tray of seafood uneasily then looks the Captain and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a burger and fries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Beck laugh as they sit at a finely set table on t deck with the Captain. AS WE PULL BACK the ship becomes smaller and smaller in t distance and WE ARE AT THE

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE OF THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: riding the swells, rising and falling before slipping beneath the waves and descending again into the cold depths.
